intro: Ardisia gambleana, commonly known as the glossy buckeye, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy red berries. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, while the berries are toxic to humans and animals. Ardisia gambleana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
